metadata.Title: CVE-2018-10191 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
In versions of mruby up to and including 1.4.0, an integer overflow existsin src/vm.c::mrb_vm_exec() when handling OP_GETUPVAR in the presence ofdeep scope nesting, resulting in a use-after-free. An attacker that cancause Ruby code to be run can use this to possibly execute arbitrary code.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-10191` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

mruby - 1.4.1-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mruby package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.4.1-2').
